image.altText: A graphic of a pair of handcuffs made up of the words "use of force", "visible marks", and "to the ground".

props.synopsis: Questionable uses of force by staff on children and insufficient recording of incidents in Canberra's only youth prison are just a few of the critical findings in an independent oversight committee's new report.

title.children: 'Unacceptable' incident reporting at Canberra's only youth prison: report

image.altText: A crowd of people waving flags walks along a street.

props.synopsis: Pro-Palestinian demonstrations were held across the country today, with organisers claiming crowd numbers to be in the tens of thousands.

title.children: Around 2,000 turn out in Canberra for pro-Palestinian demonstration

image.altText: A large flock of seagulls outside Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of seagulls are ruffling feathers outside Parliament House, with the birds seeing the island in the middle of the forecourt water feature as a perfect nesting ground for their breeding season.

title.children: Seagulls reaching plague proportions outside Parliament House

image.altText: Three uniformed police officers stand next to a police car parked in front of a house surrounded by police tape.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old man is charged with murder after a 55-year-old man with significant facial injuries was found dead at a home in Goulburn on Friday morning.

title.children: Man charged with murder after 55yo found dead in Goulburn

image.altText: A picture of the Ainslie Football Club emblem on a brick wall.

props.synopsis: Zoning changes to a Canberra football club are approved, paving the way for hundreds of new terrace homes, apartments and townhouses to be built on the side of its oval.

title.children: Football club site zoning changes pave the way for new Canberra homes

image.altText: Trish and Ian, two older people, stand and smile in a garden outside a house.

props.synopsis: Stellulata is a purpose-built co-housing project designed by three Canberra couples who wanted to enjoy both privacy and maintain community connections as they age.

title.children: Three Canberra couples create communal home by changing planning laws

image.altText: A lawyer with sunglasses outside court

props.synopsis: Zali Burrows's description of Bruce Lehrmann's appeal against last year's defamation ruling neglected that her client was the applicant — and now appellant — in a civil proceeding.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer forgets key detail: the defamation case was his idea

image.altText: A man with short hair wearing a yellow, white and black sweater sits in a classroom smiling, with children in the background.

props.synopsis: After never seeing primary school teaching as a career path, Ryan Brown now believes he's found his "calling", but he's one of just two male classroom teachers at his Canberra primary school.

title.children: Many primary school kids will never have a male teacher, and experts say that's a problem

image.altText: Jane Dahlstrom looks through glass at specimens

props.synopsis: At the Peter Herdson Museum at Canberra Hospital are more than 1,500 preserved organs and tissues, used to teach medical students and other health professionals about the inner mysteries of the human body.

title.children: 'Rather unusual letter': Personal donations build a museum of body parts

image.altText: Students from the NCP in Bangladesh.

props.synopsis: Bangladesh's student uprising forced their prime minister to flee. Now they're trying to become a force for change from within the political system.

title.children: University students overthrew their country's dictator. Now comes the hard part

image.altText: Three photos of journalists wearing press vests

props.synopsis: Israel has launched a series of attacks on the Nasser Hospital in southern Gaza, with local health authorities reporting at least 20 people have been killed.

title.children: Five journalists killed in Israeli strike on last functioning hospital in south Gaza

image.altText: CBA logo on black wall next to yellow tiled wall

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth Bank gave a problem gambler more than $13,000 in personal loans despite his transaction history with the bank showing he was spending as much as half his income on a months-long betting binge.

title.children: 'Back to their old tricks': Bank approved loans to problem gambler

image.altText: A white man with short brown hair and a pink polo shirt sitting in a wheelchair

props.synopsis: Jono Bredin was excited to be invited to speak at an inclusive housing summit, but soon found out there were no flights on any airline that could safely get him there.

title.children: The irony of being unable to attend an accessibility event due to inaccessible transport

image.altText: Kilmar Abrego Garcia standing in a crowd with supporters.

props.synopsis: The Salvadoran migrant at the centre of a row over US President Donald Trump's hardline immigration policies was sent to a notorious jail and subsequently charged with offences his lawyers say are vindictive.

title.children: Kilmar Abrego Garcia detained by ICE, faces deportation to Uganda

image.altText: Murray Watt walking in front of a building.

props.synopsis: The environment minister says he has heard a message loud and clear from last week's productivity round table that the "urgent" rewrite of Australia's environmental approval laws should be sped up.

title.children: Environment law overhaul will be sped up and have broader ambitions, Watt says

image.altText: A hazy view of mountains over suburbia.

props.synopsis: The state government launched an annual rent review in July to determine if social housing recipients were still within the income limit.

title.children: Nine social housing recipients revealed to own investment properties

image.altText: brown brick building on a river's edge

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian council has been criticised for funding a professional development course at one of the world's most prestigious universities for one of its executive officers during a time of rising rates and cost-of-living challenges.

title.children: Council covers $27k bill for executive's 'Harvard experience' trip

image.altText: A school student sits against a row of lockers with their head in their hands.

props.synopsis: Support service Kids Helpline has received more than 1,000 reports from young people of abusive and controlling behaviour from peers, including friends.

title.children: More young people are reporting coercive control from peers

image.altText: Greg McMahon stands in front of a wired fence on the perimeter of the Rossdale Golf Course.

props.synopsis: Some community members in Melbourne's south-east are fighting plans to sell a public golf course, as the club behind it grapples with growing debt.

title.children: Residents up in arms over plans to sell a Melbourne golf course to developers

image.altText: A man sits at a table with paper and a glass jug in front of cabinets and a mirror on the wall

props.synopsis: A South Australian ENGIE customer says he was slapped with a $1,200 electricity bill for a single month last year. It follows the company issuing price "corrections" to 3,000 South Australian ENGIE customers.

title.children: Customer slapped with $1,200 energy bill for one month wants better protection

image.altText: Joanne Ciconte on the grid before a race, no helmet, smiling, using a warm-up band

props.synopsis: With two top-10 finishes already achieved in 2025, 16-year-old Joanne Ciconte is aiming to build confidence and experience during the final weekends of the season.

title.children: Ciconte chasing 'patience and precision' as F1 Academy returns

image.altText: A sketch of a woman with brown hair with her hand holding a tissue in front of her face.

props.synopsis: The convicted triple-murderer faced lunch survivor Ian Wilkinson and her victims' loved ones during an emotional pre-sentence hearing in Melbourne on Monday.

title.children: Prosecutor wants jail with no parole for mushroom murderer Erin Patterson

image.altText: Police cars on a street with officers outside of the vehicles

props.synopsis: A man will face court charged with murder after emergency services found a 27-year-old man with fatal stab wounds at a property in Yeppoon.

title.children: Man charged with murder after fatal stabbing on central Queensland coast

image.altText: nsw premier chris minns and other ministers stand at the partially built woollahra station

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns is vowing to stare down criticism over his rezoning plan for up to 10,000 new homes in Woollahra and Edgecliff.

title.children: Fresh battlelines drawn over 'game-changing' housing plan in Sydney suburb

image.altText: A mob of young people gesture toward people out of shot at a protest, as some prepare to throw implements

props.synopsis: Some 1,200 police were sent to protect Indonesia's parliament in Jakarta, as thousands of students took to the streets in anger over MP allowances.

title.children: Police and protesters clash in Indonesia as anger grows over MP pay

image.altText: A black and white photo of Janet Dawson as a young woman, wearing a black t-shirt, sitting in front of her artwork

props.synopsis: Janet Dawson has long been considered one of Australia's most acclaimed visual artists. Now, her six-decade career is the subject of a major survey at AGNSW.

title.children: 90-year-old artist finally gets her due in new blockbuster exhibition

image.altText: A man in suit, tie and shirt, walking in the street with a yellow building in the background.

props.synopsis: A Mackay-based surgeon tells a coronial inquest he was "very, very upset" that nurses waited almost an hour to call him after his patient said she could not breathe following a thyroid operation.

title.children: Surgeon tells inquest of harrowing night before patient's death

image.altText: A street art mural in Port Hedland.

props.synopsis: Local Government Minister Hannah Beazley says she's examining all options with regards to the Pilbara town's controversial remaining councillors.

title.children: Port Hedland mayor hopes resignation will 'reset' council after farcical term

image.altText: Three different polaroid images of the same young girl

props.synopsis: A Queensland court has heard there is an "extremely large" case against a third person charged in relation to the alleged murder of Bundaberg teenager Pheobe Bishop.

title.children: 130 witness statements against man accused of using dead teen's phone

image.altText: A portrait shot of a rugby league player in red and green

props.synopsis: The South Sydney Rabbitohs say the club is aware of allegations against the 29-year-old player.

title.children: NRL star Brandon Smith hit with drug supply and betting charges

image.altText: artist impression of marine reptile that looks a bit like a long nosed dolphin

props.synopsis: Discovered on an outback station by a neighbour and potentially 100 million years old, the fossil will be put on display at the Australian Age of Dinosaurs museum in Queensland.

title.children: Neighbour uncovers near complete 7-metre fossil on western Queensland property

image.altText: A split image of a Ford Ranger PHEV, with the front half outside and the back half charging in a garage.

props.synopsis: Plug-in hybrids now account for a quarter of electric vehicle sales, as Australians reluctant to entirely drop the fuel tank opt for a compromise.

title.children: Plug-in hybrids are taking over EVs. It wasn't meant to happen this way

image.altText: Benedict Bryant in a suit outside court

props.synopsis: Confronting CCTV footage played to a Sydney court has revealed the moment an Indigenous teenager collided with an unmarked police vehicle on a trail bike at an intersection, as the trial of an officer charged over the incident begins.

title.children: Officer 'established roadblock' before teen's fatal collision, court told

image.altText: Three small purple bottles of sunscreen are shown on a purple background.

props.synopsis: Skincare brand Naked Sundays has pulled one of its sunscreen products from the Australian market, including from cosmetics retailer MECCA, amid industry-wide questions about whether sunscreen products are meeting their sun protection claims.

title.children: Second brand pulls sunscreen from shelves over SPF concerns

image.altText: A mid-shot shot of a man and a woman posing for a photo standing up inside their living room.

props.synopsis: As her daughter's mental health reached crisis point, WA mother Simone tried in vain to find help amid the state's buckling health system.

title.children: Teen in mental health crisis waits 60 hours in Perth ED without treatment
